meanings.definition: To silently articulate words without vocalizing them.
meanings.sent1: She subvocalizes the lyrics of her favorite song while reading.
meanings.sent2: He subvocalizes the instructions to himself as he follows along.
meanings.sent3: The little girl subvocalizes her secret wishes to the stars each night.
meanings.sent4: As she reads the poem, her mind subvocalizes the emotions behind each line.
meanings.sent5: Subvocalizing the recipe helped her remember all the ingredients accurately.

meanings.definition: The act of forming words in the mind without speaking them aloud.
meanings.sent1: His subvocalizes often give away his deep thoughts during class.
meanings.sent2: The subvocalizes of the characters in the book were vivid in her imagination.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the audience's subvocalizes during his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet library, the only sound was the faint subvocalizes of the readers.
meanings.sent5: The subvocalizes of the protagonist revealed his inner turmoil to the readers.
